originalTitle: Russian 'pick-up artist' accused of secretly filming women in Ghana
title: Always Ask First: Being Kind and Respecting Privacy!
content:
Hello, my wonderful friends across Africa! It's your friendly news reporter here, bringing you a very important story about being kind and respecting everyone's personal space. This story is from a beautiful country in Africa called Ghana.

What Happened in Ghana?

Imagine someone drawing in your favorite coloring book without asking you first. Or taking your toy without saying, "Please may I?" How would that make you feel? Maybe a little bit sad, or a little bit angry, right? Well, something like that happened, but with cameras. In Ghana, there was a man who was filming people. But he did not ask them if it was okay to film them. He filmed them without their permission. This is not kind, and it makes people feel very uncomfortable.

Why is Asking Permission Important?

When we ask permission, it shows that we respect other people. It shows we care about their feelings. It's like asking, "Can I borrow your pencil?" or "Can I play with you?" It's a polite thing to do. Everyone has a right to their own space, and to decide who films them. This is called privacy. Imagine you are playing quietly in your room. You wouldn't want someone to just come in and start filming you without knocking and asking, "May I come in?" This is how many people felt in Ghana. Did you know? Ghana is a sunny country in West Africa, famous for its yummy jollof rice and beautiful Kente cloth!

What is Ghana Doing About It?

The people in Ghana felt that what the man did was not right. So, the leaders of Ghana decided to do something about it. They want the man to come back to Ghana to talk about what happened. But the man is not in Ghana right now. He is in another country far away, called Russia. Russia is a very, very big country, much bigger than Ghana! So, Ghana has asked Russia for help. They have asked Russia to send the man back to Ghana. This way, Ghana can talk to him and make sure everyone knows that it's important to ask before you film someone. It's about fairness and making sure everyone feels safe and respected. Did you know? Countries all around the world often work together, just like friends help each other in school!

What is Privacy?

Privacy means having your own space and being able to decide who sees you or knows about you. It's like having your own secret diary that only you can read. Or having your own thoughts that nobody else can hear unless you tell them. When someone films you without asking, it takes away some of your privacy. It's like they are looking into your secret diary without your permission. That's why it's so important to protect our privacy and respect other people's privacy too. Did you know? Every person, big or small, has rights, and one of those rights is to have their privacy respected!

Cameras are Everywhere!

Today, cameras are everywhere! Lots of people have cameras on their phones. We see cameras in shops, and sometimes on the street. Cameras can be fun for taking pictures of holidays, friends, and family. But we must always remember to use them nicely. Before you point your camera at someone, always ask, "May I take your picture?" or "Is it okay if I film you?" If they say no, that's okay! Just put your camera down and respect their choice. It shows you are a kind and thoughtful person. Did you know? The first cameras were invented a very long time ago, even before your grandparents were born!

Learning to be Respectful

This story from Ghana teaches us a very important lesson: always be respectful of others. Always ask for permission before you do something that involves another person, especially when it comes to cameras or their personal space. Being kind, asking permission, and respecting privacy helps everyone feel happy and safe. It helps us live together in peace, both in our homes, in our schools, and across all the wonderful countries of Africa and the world. So remember, my little reporters: if you want to take a picture, just ask! A simple "Please may I?" can make a very big difference.
summary: Ghana is asking another country, Russia, to send a man back because he filmed people without asking their permission, which made them feel uncomfortable and disrespected.
whyMatters: It's super important to always ask people before you film or take their picture, because everyone deserves to have their personal space and privacy respected, and it's kind to ask first.

originalTitle: Motorbike raids on villages kill dozens in Nigeria
title: Motorbike raids on villages kill dozens in Nigeria
content: Armed men shot locals dead, set homes alight and abducted an "undetermined" number of people in Niger State.

title: Planned US-funded baby vaccine trial in Guinea-Bissau blasted by WHO
content: Giving some newborns in Guinea-Bissau an established hepatitis B treatment but not others is "unethical", it says.
